properties.areaDesc: Vermillion, IN; Warren, IN; Fountain, IN; Tippecanoe, IN; Parke, IN
properties.headline: Flood Warning issued March 2 at 1:15PM EST until March 5 at 1:00PM EST by NWS Indianapolis IN
properties.description:
...The National Weather Service in Indianapolis has issued a Flood
Warning for portions of the following waterways in western Indiana...

Wabash River...

.Brief lowland flooding is expected along much of the Wabash River
later this week as a result of between a half inch and an inch that
fell on a basin already in action stage.  Flooding will begin by
Wednesday for most sites and last through the end of the week.

Flooding will be brief and generally only a couple of feet above
flood stage.  Dry conditions through the rest of the week will
help keep flooding brief.

The National Weather Service in Indianapolis has issued a

* Flood Warning for
the Wabash River at Lafayette.
* from Tuesday evening to Thursday afternoon.
* At 12:30 PM Monday the stage was 6.9 feet.
* Flood stage is 11.0 feet.
* Minor flooding is forecast.
* Forecast...Rise above flood stage by Tuesday evening and continue
to rise to near 11.8 feet by Wednesday morning.  It will fall below
flood stage by late Wednesday night.
* At 12.0 feet...High water affects a few low river cabins and county
roads.
properties.instruction:
Precautionary/Preparedness Actions...

Motorists should never drive into flood water. Turn around and go
another way. Keep children away from flooded areas. Recreational and
agricultural interests should remain alert to changing river
conditions.

For detailed flood information go to weather.gov/ind on the web and
click on rivers and lakes.
